content.description: This is probably the best V1 in the forest, great quality line with fun moves all the way up.
content.location: Stand-start on the crescent shaped crimp (left hand) and left-rising shallow crack or pinch (right hand). Climb up to the obvious divot, then gain the right-rising crack. Traverse right slightly to top-out.

content.description: This is a fun climb for a V1, should tread lightly on it too.
content.location: Stand-start on small slopers. Climb the slab up and left to finish over the featured bulge. Variation A - V0: Stand-start eight feet left of “El Condorito” below the featured bulge. Climb straight up to finish as “El Condorito”.

content.description: A relatively tall cliff band is facing into a reforestation area (note: there are two; this one is not visible from the yellow blazed trail). Named after the Chilean comic strip, come here for some fun and technical slab climbing.
